## Component() function

Component decorator, used to mark a class as a component. Components are lifecycle-aware units that can listen to application events.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function Component(identifier?: string, options?: IComponentOptions): ClassDecorator;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

identifier


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional component identifier. If not provided, will use the class name.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[IComponentOptions](./koatty_core.icomponentoptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional configuration options for the component


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

ClassDecorator

ClassDecorator

## Example


```ts
@Component("RouterComponent", { scope: 'core', priority: 100 })
export class RouterComponent implements IComponent {
  @OnEvent(AppEvent.loadRouter)
  async initRouter(app: KoattyApplication) {
    // initialize router
  }
}
```
